intro: Synthyris canbyi, commonly known as the Canby's synthyris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, and it is often found in open woodlands and canyons. Synthyris canbyi is a relatively rare species, and its conservation status is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
